static _find_corrections(A, b, tol, lapack_driver)[source]Â¶

Find the corrections to the parameters by solving the system of linear equations with SVD technique

Parameters

  • A (array) â matrix with the derivatives

  • b (array) â rhs vector

  • tol (float) â the tolerance value

  • lapack_driver (str) â the lapack routine

Returns

the corrections, the rank of the matrix and the matrix with the singular values

Return type

tuple

Remarks:
  1. There are two similar procedures for SVD from numpy

    and scipy. In their older versions the definitions of the default tol value is different

  2. Tol controls which and how many linear combinations of the

    parameters will be ignored since the matrix is singular

optimize(ypar, yfixed, calculate_data, niter, derivative, tol, lapack_driver, step_size)[source]Â¶

Implementation of the SVD algorithm used for nonliner least squares fitting. Solves the linear system Ax = b using SVD. Starting with a trial set of parameters, the system Ax=b is solved on each iteration for the corrections x to the current set of parameters x_0, yielding and a new set of parameters x_1 so that: (x_1 = x_0 + x). The matrix A contains the derivatives of the data wrt the parameters and b is the rhs vector.

Parameters

  • ypar (array) â The parameters which to be optimized

  • yfixed (array) â Whether the parameter is fixed or free

  • calculate_data ([type]) â [description]

  • niter (int) â The number of iterations

  • derivative (str) â Whether to use numerical or analytical derivative

  • tol (float) â The tolerance parameter of SVD: determines which linear combinations of parameters to be discarded by SVD

  • lapack_driver (str) â [description]

  • step_size (float) â Used to change the parameters during the computation of derivatives

Returns

The optimized parameters

Return type

array
